intro: Mabea atroviridis, commonly known as the dark-viridian mabea, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along streambanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
